page.title: 07 THE SHOP AND POST OFFICE
page.content:
{The Shop} The only shop in North Stainley village is run by Mrs Marcia Stockhill helped by Tina Atkinson. It is situated by North Stainley Garage on the site of the old Smithy. It sells most basic foods such as milk, bread, eggs, tinned and frozen foods;but not fresh vegetables.It is also the newsagents, sweet and tobacco shop.
{The Post Office} The Post Office is close to the shop in North Stainley. In addition to the normal postal services available it sells greeting cards. In 1908 Mrs Park, the blacksmith's wife took over the Post Office. Their daughter Mrs Maddison still runs it today.
